meanings.definition: A person who helps another commit a crime.
meanings.sent1: The accomplice waited in the car while the thief robbed the store.
meanings.sent2: The police arrested the accomplice along with the main suspect.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy accomplice accidentally dropped the stolen goods on the way out.
meanings.sent4: Her silence made her an accomplice to his deception.
meanings.sent5: The accomplice's guilty expression gave away their involvement in the crime.

meanings.definition: A person who assists in a wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: The young accomplice helped his friend cheat on the test.
meanings.sent2: She felt like an accomplice when she didn't speak up against the bullying.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous accomplice played a prank on their teacher.
meanings.sent4: His laughter made him an unwitting accomplice to her practical joke.
meanings.sent5: The loyal accomplice stood by their friend's side through thick and thin.
